TITLE: Modern ABAP Functional Constructs
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates modern functional programming constructs in ABAP compared to older procedural approaches. Shows variable declarations, string operations, loops, and table operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sap/styleguides/blob/main/clean-abap/CleanABAP.md#2025-04-22_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: ABAP
CODE:
```
DATA(variable) = 'A'.
DATA(uppercase) = to_upper( lowercase ).
index += 1.         " >= NW 7.54
index = index + 1.  " < NW 7.54
DATA(object) = NEW /clean/my_class( ).
result = VALUE #( FOR row IN input ( row-text ) ).
DATA(line) = value_pairs[ name = 'A' ].
DATA(line) = VALUE #( value_pairs[ name = 'A' ] OPTIONAL ).
DATA(exists) = xsdbool( line_exists( value_pairs[ name = 'A' ] ) ).
```

TITLE: Dependency Injection Implementation in ABAP Constructor
DESCRIPTION: Shows proper dependency injection through constructor parameters rather than setter methods. This ensures dependencies are properly initialized and cannot be changed after object creation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sap/styleguides/blob/main/clean-abap/CleanABAP.md#2025-04-22_snippet_145

LANGUAGE: ABAP
CODE:
```
METHODS constructor
  IMPORTING
    customizing_reader TYPE REF TO if_fra_cust_obj_model_reader.

METHOD constructor.
  me->customizing_reader = customizing_reader.
ENDMETHOD.
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/sap/styleguides/blob/main/clean-abap/CleanABAP.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

CODE:
```
CONSTANTS max_wait_time_in_seconds TYPE i ...
DATA customizing_entries TYPE STANDARD TABLE ...
METHODS read_user_preferences ...
CLASS /clean/user_preference_reader ...
```

TITLE: Modern vs Obsolete SQL Host Variables
DESCRIPTION: Compares modern @-escaped host variables with obsolete unescaped form in ABAP SQL statements. The modern syntax provides better clarity between program variables and database columns.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sap/styleguides/blob/main/clean-abap/CleanABAP.md#2025-04-22_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: ABAP
CODE:
```
SELECT *
  FROM spfli
  WHERE carrid = @carrid AND
        connid = @connid
  INTO TABLE @itab.
```

LANGUAGE: ABAP
CODE:
```
SELECT *
  FROM spfli
  WHERE carrid = carrid AND
        connid = connid
  INTO TABLE itab.
```

TITLE: Using Class-Based Exceptions in ABAP
DESCRIPTION: Shows the proper way to use modern class-based exceptions in ABAP instead of outdated non-class-based exceptions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sap/styleguides/blob/main/clean-abap/CleanABAP.md#2025-04-22_snippet_112

LANGUAGE: ABAP
CODE:
```
TRY.
    get_component_types( ).
  CATCH cx_has_deep_components_error.
ENDTRY.
```

LANGUAGE: ABAP
CODE:
```
get_component_types(
  EXCEPTIONS
    has_deep_components = 1
    OTHERS              = 2 ).
```

TITLE: Using ABAP Test Double Framework
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the usage of ABAP's test double framework for creating mock objects. Shows how to configure return values and verify method calls.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sap/styleguides/blob/main/clean-abap/CleanABAP.md#2025-04-22_snippet_146

LANGUAGE: ABAP
CODE:
```
DATA(customizing_reader) = CAST /clean/customizing_reader( cl_abap_testdouble=>create( '/clean/default_custom_reader' ) ).
cl_abap_testdouble=>configure_call( customizing_reader )->returning( sub_claim_customizing ).
customizing_reader->read( 'SOME_ID' ).
```

DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use built-in methods instead of regular expressions for simple string operations. This approach is often more readable and efficient.

CODE:

```
IF input IS NOT INITIAL.
" IF matches( val = input  regex = '.+' ).

WHILE contains( val = input  sub = 'abc' ).

```

TITLE: Efficient Table Reading with Exception Handling in ABAP
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the recommended pattern for reading from tables when a row is expected to exist. Uses exception handling to handle missing records instead of performing unnecessary checks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sap/styleguides/blob/main/clean-abap/CleanABAP.md#2025-04-22_snippet_22

```
TRY.

    RAISE EXCEPTION NEW /clean/my_data_not_found( ).
ENDTRY.
```

TITLE: Using NEW Operator for Object Creation in ABAP
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates various ways to use the NEW operator for cleaner object instantiation compared to CREATE OBJECT. This approach is more concise and modern.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sap/styleguides/blob/main/clean-abap/CleanABAP.md#2025-04-22_snippet_65

LANGUAGE: ABAP
CODE:
```
DATA object TYPE REF TO /clean/some_number_range.
object = NEW #( '/CLEAN/CXTGEN' )
...
DATA(object) = NEW /clean/some_number_range( '/CLEAN/CXTGEN' ).
...
DATA(object) = CAST /clean/number_range( NEW /clean/some_number_range( '/CLEAN/CXTGEN' ) ).
```

TITLE: Table Filtering in ABAP using FILTER
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to filter tables using the modern FILTER operator compared to traditional loop-based filtering approach.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sap/styleguides/blob/main/clean-abap/sub-sections/ModernABAPLanguageElements.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: ABAP
CODE:
```
bank_accounts = FILTER #( accounts
                          WHERE account_type = 'B' ).
```

CODE:
```
DATA bank_account TYPE bank_account.
LOOP AT accounts INTO bank_account WHERE account_type = 'B'.
  INSERT bank_account INTO TABLE bank_accounts.
ENDLOOP.
```

TITLE: Object Construction in ABAP using NEW Operator
DESCRIPTION: Shows modern object construction using NEW operator compared to legacy CREATE OBJECT syntax. Includes examples for both direct instantiation and casting.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sap/styleguides/blob/main/clean-abap/sub-sections/ModernABAPLanguageElements.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

CODE:
```
DATA(account) = NEW cl_account( ).

DATA(dref) = NEW struct_type( component_1 = 10

```

LANGUAGE: ABAP
CODE:
```
DATA(account) = CAST if_account( NEW cl_account( ) ).

DATA data_structure TYPE REF TO struct_type.
CREATE DATA data_structure.
data_reference->component_1 = 10.
data_reference->component_2 = 'a'.
```

TITLE: Decomposing Complex Conditions in ABAP
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to decompose complex conditions into named variables, making the code more readable and the logic clearer.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sap/styleguides/blob/main/clean-abap/CleanABAP.md#2025-04-22_snippet_46

LANGUAGE: ABAP
CODE:
```
DATA(example_provided) = xsdbool( example_a IS NOT INITIAL OR
                                  example_b IS NOT INITIAL ).

DATA(one_example_fits) = xsdbool( applies( example_a ) = abap_true OR
                                  applies( example_b ) = abap_true OR
                                  fits( example_b ) = abap_true ).

IF example_provided = abap_true AND
   one_example_fits = abap_true.
```

TITLE: Expressing Intent Through Code Structure in ABAP
DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to express intent through well-structured and named methods rather than relying on comments. It breaks down a date correction algorithm into clearly named methods that explain their purpose.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sap/styleguides/blob/main/clean-abap/CleanABAP_fr.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: ABAP
CODE:
```
METHOD correct_day_to_last_in_month.
  WHILE is_invalid( date ).
    reduce_day_by_one( CHANGING date = date ).
  ENDWHILE.
ENDMETHOD.

METHOD is_invalid.
  DATA zero_if_invalid TYPE i.
  zero_if_invalid = date.
  result = xsdbool( zero_if_invalid = 0 ).
ENDMETHOD.

METHOD reduce_day_by_one.
  date+6(2) = date+6(2) - 1.
ENDMETHOD.
```

TITLE: Conditional Logic in ABAP
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates modern conditional expressions using COND and SWITCH operators for cleaner control flow.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sap/styleguides/blob/main/clean-abap/sub-sections/ModernABAPLanguageElements.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: ABAP
CODE:
```
DATA(value) = COND #( WHEN status = open THEN 1
                      WHEN status = blocked THEN 3
                      ELSE 7 ).

DATA(status) = SWITCH #( scrum_status
    WHEN scrum_status_open THEN status_waiting
    WHEN scrum_status_in_process THEN status_busy
    WHEN scrum_status_blocked THEN status_alarm
    WHEN scrum_status_done THEN status_ok ).
```

DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the preferred way to implement enumerations using ABAP's native ENUM type compared to constant interfaces.

LANGUAGE: ABAP
CODE:
```

  PUBLIC SECTION.
    TYPES: BEGIN OF ENUM type,
             warning,
             error,
           END OF ENUM type.
ENDCLASS.
```

TITLE: LOCAL FRIENDS Usage for Test Access in ABAP
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use LOCAL FRIENDS to access dependency-inverting constructors in test classes while maintaining encapsulation in production code.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sap/styleguides/blob/main/clean-abap/CleanABAP.md#2025-04-22_snippet_147

LANGUAGE: ABAP
CODE:
```
CLASS /clean/unit_tests DEFINITION.
  PRIVATE SECTION.
    DATA cut TYPE REF TO /clean/interface_under_test.
    METHODS setup.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS /clean/class_under_test DEFINITION LOCAL FRIENDS unit_tests.

CLASS unit_tests IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD setup.
    DATA(mock) = cl_abap_testdouble=>create( '/clean/some_mock' ).
    cut = NEW /clean/class_under_test( mock ).
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.
```

DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates preferred functional method call style over procedural style for better readability.

LANGUAGE: ABAP

```
modify->update( node           = /clean/my_bo_c=>node-item
```

TITLE: Using Exceptions Instead of Return Codes in ABAP
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use exceptions instead of return codes for error handling, which keeps method signatures clean and provides more detailed error information.

TITLE: Initializing Class Under Test with Minimal Mocks
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to properly initialize a test class with only necessary mock objects. Avoids setting up unused test doubles that could distract from the test's purpose.

DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates structuring code into well-named methods rather than using comment sections to separate functionality, which improves readability and prevents variable scope issues.

TITLE: Creating Custom Assertions in ABAP
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create custom assertion methods to avoid code duplication and improve readability. This example creates a helper method to check if a table contains an entry with a specific key.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sap/styleguides/blob/main/clean-abap/CleanABAP.md#2025-04-22_snippet_160

LANGUAGE: ABAP
CODE:
```
METHODS assert_contains
  IMPORTING
    actual_entries TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF entries_tab
    expected_key   TYPE key_structure.

METHOD assert_contains.
  TRY.
      actual_entries[ key = expected_key ].
    CATCH cx_sy_itab_line_not_found.
      cl_abap_unit_assert=>fail( |Couldn't find the key { expected_key }| ).
  ENDTRY.
ENDMETHOD.
```

TITLE: Using RETURNING Parameter in ABAP Method
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the clean use of RETURNING parameter for returning a method result. This approach enables concise method calls and method chaining, making the code more readable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sap/styleguides/blob/main/clean-abap/CleanABAP.md#2025-04-22_snippet_83

LANGUAGE: ABAP
CODE:
```

    number        TYPE i
  RETURNING

DATA(result) = square( 42 ).
```

TITLE: Implementing Small Methods in ABAP
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to keep methods small and focused on a single task. The example shows a method with 3-5 statements that reads and parses version filters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sap/styleguides/blob/main/clean-abap/CleanABAP.md#2025-04-22_snippet_101

LANGUAGE: ABAP
CODE:
```
METHOD read_and_parse_version_filters.
  DATA(active_model_version) = read_random_version_under( model_guid ).
  DATA(filter_json) = read_model_version_filters( active_model_version-guid ).
  result = parse_model_version_filters( filter_json ).
ENDMETHOD.
```

DESCRIPTION: Shows how to handle multiple alternatives using CASE statement instead of ELSE IF chains for better readability and performance.

TITLE: Using String Templates for Text Assembly in ABAP
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the best practice of using string templates (pipe syntax) to assemble text with variables, which clearly distinguishes between literal and variable content.

TITLE: Utility Class Implementation in ABAP
DESCRIPTION: An example of a well-designed utility class that provides stateless string manipulation functions. This is one of the few acceptable use cases for static methods in ABAP.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sap/styleguides/blob/main/clean-abap/CleanABAP.md#2025-04-22_snippet_60

LANGUAGE: ABAP
CODE:
```
CLASS /clean/string_utils DEFINITION [...].
  CLASS-METHODS trim
   IMPORTING
     string        TYPE string
   RETURNING
     VALUE(result) TYPE string.
ENDCLASS.

METHOD retrieve.
  DATA(trimmed_name) = /clean/string_utils=>trim( name ).
  result = read( trimmed_name ).
ENDMETHOD.
```

DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates creating abstract super classes for exceptions to enable catching all application-specific exceptions and adding common functionality.

TITLE: Using Single Parameter Type in ABAP Method
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates a clean method with only one type of output parameter (RETURNING), which indicates the method does one thing clearly. The method also uses proper exception handling instead of error flags.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sap/styleguides/blob/main/clean-abap/CleanABAP.md#2025-04-22_snippet_87

TITLE: Exception Wrapping - Good Practice
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to properly wrap foreign exceptions to maintain decoupling according to the Law of Demeter.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sap/styleguides/blob/main/clean-abap/CleanABAP.md#2025-04-22_snippet_118

LANGUAGE: ABAP
CODE:
```
METHODS generate RAISING cx_generation_failure.

METHOD generate.
  TRY.
      generator->generate( ).
    CATCH cx_amdp_generation_failure INTO DATA(exception).
      RAISE EXCEPTION NEW cx_generation_failure( previous = exception ).
  ENDTRY.
ENDMETHOD.
```

TITLE: Using Exception Subclasses for Error Distinction in ABAP
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use exception subclasses and error codes to allow callers to distinguish between different error situations while maintaining a single exception type.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sap/styleguides/blob/main/clean-abap/CleanABAP.md#2025-04-22_snippet_114

LANGUAGE: ABAP
CODE:
```
CLASS cx_bad_generation_variable DEFINITION INHERITING FROM cx_generation_error.
CLASS cx_bad_code_composer_template DEFINITION INHERITING FROM cx_generation_error.

METHODS generate RAISING cx_generation_error.

TRY.
    generator->generate( ).
  CATCH cx_bad_generation_variable.
    log_failure( ).
  CATCH cx_bad_code_composer_template INTO DATA(bad_template_exception).
    show_error_to_user( bad_template_exception ).
  CATCH cx_generation_error INTO DATA(other_exception).
    RAISE EXCEPTION NEW cx_application_error( previous =  other_exception ).
ENDTRY.
```

CODE:

TITLE: Unit Test Implementation for Enumeration Constants
DESCRIPTION: Comprehensive test class implementation that validates the enumeration constants against domain fixed values. Includes setup method and two test methods to ensure bidirectional consistency.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sap/styleguides/blob/main/clean-abap/sub-sections/Enumerations.md#2025-04-22_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: ABAP
CODE:
```
CLASS ltcl_constant_pattern DEFINITION CREATE PRIVATE
 FOR TESTING
 RISK LEVEL HARMLESS
 DURATION SHORT.

  PUBLIC SECTION.
  PROTECTED SECTION.
  PRIVATE SECTION.
    CONSTANTS class_name TYPE classname VALUE '/CLEAN/MESSAGE_SEVERITY'.
    CONSTANTS domain_name TYPE domname  VALUE 'DOM_MSG_SEVERITY'.
    DATA domain_values TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF dd07v.
    DATA constants_of_enum_class TYPE abap_attrdescr_tab.

    METHODS setup.
    METHODS all_values_as_constant FOR TESTING.
    METHODS all_constants_in_domain FOR TESTING.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS ltcl_constant_pattern IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD setup.
    CALL FUNCTION 'DD_DOMVALUES_GET'
      EXPORTING
        domname   = domain_name
      TABLES
        dd07v_tab = domain_values
      EXCEPTIONS
        OTHERS    = 1.
    ASSERT sy-subrc = 0.

    DATA class_descr TYPE REF TO cl_abap_classdescr.
    class_descr ?= cl_abap_typedescr=>describe_by_name( class_name ).

    constants_of_enum_class = class_descr->attributes.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD all_constants_in_domain.
    LOOP AT constants_of_enum_class INTO DATA(component).
    
      ASSIGN (class_name)=>(component-name) TO FIELD-SYMBOL(<value>).
      ASSERT sy-subrc = 0.
      
      IF NOT line_exists( domain_values[ domvalue_l = <value> ] ).
        cl_abap_unit_assert=>fail( |Component { component-name } not found in domain fix values| ).
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD all_values_as_constant.
    DATA value_found TYPE abap_bool.

    LOOP AT domain_values INTO DATA(domain_value).

      CLEAR value_found.
      LOOP AT constants_of_enum_class INTO DATA(component).

        ASSIGN (class_name)=>(component-name) TO FIELD-SYMBOL(<value>).
        ASSERT sy-subrc = 0.

        IF  domain_value-domvalue_l = <value>.
          value_found = abap_true.
          EXIT.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.
      IF value_found = abap_false.
        cl_abap_unit_assert=>fail( |Domainvalue { domain_value-domvalue_l } not available as constant| ).
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDMETHOD.

ENDCLASS.
```
